skill.name: baml-integration
skill.description: Generic BAML patterns for type-safe LLM prompting. Covers schema design, DTO generation, client wrappers, and cross-language codegen. Framework-agnostic.
skill.summary: Generic BAML patterns for type-safe LLM prompting. Covers schema design, DTO generation, client wrap...
skill.author: Consiliency

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and guidance patterns for BAML framework usage. No executable code, no network calls, no file I/O operations. Pure documentation skill that instructs users on BAML best practices.

content.value_statement: LLM integrations often lack type safety leading to runtime errors. This skill provides universal BAML patterns for defining type-safe prompts, generating Python and TypeScript clients, and maintaining consistent schemas across your project.
actual_capabilities: Define type-safe BAML schemas with enums, classes, and unions
Generate Python and TypeScript clients automatically
Implement retry policies and fallback chains for LLM calls
Create DTOs for structured LLM input and output
Keep BAML schemas synchronized with database and API types
limitations: Requires baml-cli to be installed separately by user
Generated code quality depends on prompt descriptions
Users must manage API keys and LLM costs themselves

use_cases.title: Type-Safe LLM APIs
use_cases.description: Build reliable LLM-powered APIs with generated type-safe clients in Python or TypeScript

use_cases.title: End-to-End Type Safety
use_cases.description: Share BAML types between backend and frontend for consistent data handling

use_cases.title: Structured Data Extraction
use_cases.description: Define schemas for extracting structured data from unstructured text using LLMs

prompt_templates.title: Create Simple Type
prompt_templates.prompt: Define a BAML class called [ClassName] with fields: [field1] string, [field2] int. Add @description annotations for each field.

prompt_templates.title: Create Function
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a BAML function called [FunctionName] that takes [InputType] and returns [OutputType]. Use client GPT4 and write a prompt template.

prompt_templates.title: Generate Client
prompt_templates.prompt: Run baml-cli generate to regenerate clients. Verify the generated code has correct types in baml_client/types.[py|ts].

prompt_templates.title: Error Handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Define a BAML function that returns a union type [SuccessType] | Error for graceful error handling with retry logic.

output_examples.input: Create a BAML schema for book analysis
output: Define class BookAnalysis with title, author, summary, rating (float), and tags (string[])
Define enum AnalysisType for SUMMARY, THEMES, CHARACTERS, SENTIMENT
Create function AnalyzeBook that takes text and analysis_type, returns BookAnalysis

best_practices: Always define explicit types for LLM inputs and outputs instead of using generic strings
Add @description annotations on all fields to guide the LLM toward correct output
Use union types with Error for graceful failure handling in production code
anti_patterns: Using generic string types instead of specific classes and enums
Skipping @description annotations on fields, leading to unpredictable output
Defining deeply nested optional chains instead of flattened union types

faq.question: Which BAML version does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill targets BAML v2+. Check your version with baml-cli --version in your terminal.

faq.question: Does this skill generate BAML files for me?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides patterns and guidance. You write BAML files and the skill helps ensure type-safe, consistent implementations.

faq.question: Can I use BAML with Claude instead of GPT-4?
faq.answer: Yes. Define a Claude client in your clients.baml with provider anthropic and use it in your functions.

faq.question: How do I handle rate limits with BAML?
faq.answer: Configure retry_policy with exponential_backoff in your client definition, or implement a rate limiter in your wrapper code.

faq.question: Is my data safe with BAML?
faq.answer: BAML generates client code locally. Your data is only sent to the LLM provider API you configure. Review provider privacy policies.

faq.question: How does BAML differ from direct API calls?
faq.answer: BAML provides type-safe prompting with automatic validation. Direct API calls require manual parsing and type conversion.
